title: How many liters of a 12 litre mixture containing milk and water in the ratio of 2 : 3 be replaced with pure milk so that the resultant mixture contains milk and water in equal proportion? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the mixture of 12 litre milk and water the ratio is 2:3 respectively. Therefore, the amount of milk is 12 x 2/5 = 4.8 litres and water is 12 x 3/5 = 7.2 litres. The difference is …. 7.2 - 4.8 = 2.4 litre of water. To make equal ratio of milk and water half of this Water 1.2 litres is to be replaced by pure milk so that 12 litres mixture would have equal Proportion. 1.2 litres of Pure Milk Answer. Thanks.

Qty of milk+water inthe beginning = 12Litres Qty of mixture removed=X Qty of mixture left= 12-X Qty of milk in this= (2/5)(12-x)=4.8 -0.4X Pure milk added = X Hence pure milk after adding this amount=4.8+X-.4 X =4.8+.6X This qty is equal to 1/2 of 12=6 4.8+.6X =6 1.2=.6X X=1.2/.6 =2litre.
